tool.name: virannot
tool.command:
python $__tool_directory__/virannot.py --input $input --rfamdb $rfamdb.fields.path --modifiers $modifiers --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-5} --typedata $typedata_select --gcode $gcode_select --out "default" --minrepeat $minrepeat --maxrepeat $maxrepeat --minspacer $minspacer --maxspacer $maxspacer
#if $readlength --readlength $readlength #end if #if $locus --locus $locus #end if #if $gffprint --gff #end if #if str($blastevalue) --blastevalue $blastevalue #end if #if str($mincontigsize) --mincontigsize $mincontigsize #end if #if str($idthr) --idthr $idthr #end if #if str($coverthr) --coverthr $coverthr #end if #if str($diffid) --diffid $diffid #end if #if $blastexh --blastexh #end if #if str($use_diamond) --noblast --diamonddb $homologysearch.diamonddb.fields.path #else --blastdb $homologysearch.blastdb.fields.path #end if #if str($use_phmmer) --nohmmer --hmmdb $hmmsearch.hmmdb.fields.path --hmmerevalue $hmmsearch.hmmerevalue #end if

param.name: input
param.label: (Viral) contigs to annotate
param.help: Input file as a FASTA file. It can contain multiple sequences (e.g. metagenomic contigs)

param.name: rfamdb
param.label: RFAM database used for ribosomal RNA prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: modifiers
param.label: Metadata of the contigs
param.help: Modifiers per every FASTA header according to SeqIn (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Sequin/modifiers.html)

param.name: gcode_select
param.label: Number of GenBank translation table (--gcode)
param.option: Ciliate, dasycladacean and hexamita nuclear code

param.name: readlength
param.label: Read length (--readlength)
param.help: Read length for the circularity prediction

param.name: locus
param.label: Locus tag prefix (--locustag)
param.help: Name of the sequences. If the input is a multifasta file, please put a general name

param.name: gffprint
param.label: Print the output also as GFF3 file
param.help: Printing the output as GFF3 file (Default: FALSE)

param.name: use_phmmer
param.label: Use PHMMER to predict protein function using HMM

param.name: hmmdb
param.label: PHMMER database to use for protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: use_diamond
param.label: Use DIAMOND instead of BLAST to predict protein function

param.name: diamonddb
param.label: DIAMOND database
param.help: DIAMOND Protein Database that will be used for the protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: blastdb
param.label: BLAST Database
param.help: BLAST Protein Database that will be used for the protein function prediction

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: mincontigsize
param.label: Minimum contig length to be considered in the output

param.name: diffid
param.label: Max allowed difference between the ID percentages of BLAST and HHSEARCH

param.name: minrepeat
param.label: Minimum repeat length for CRISPR detection (--minrepeat)

param.name: maxrepeat
param.label: Maximum repeat length for CRISPR detection (--maxrepeat)

param.name: minspacer
param.label: Minimum spacer length for CRISPR detection (--minspacer)

param.name: maxspacer
param.label: Maximum spacer length for CRISPR detection (--maxspacer)

param.name: blastexh
param.label: Use exhaustive BLAST (--blastexh)
param.help: Use of exhaustive BLAST to predict the proteins by homology according to Fozo et al. (2010) Nucleic Acids Res (Default=FALSE)

tool.help:
**About VirAnnot** VirAnnot_ is a script written in Python 2.7 that annotates viral genomes automatically (using a de novo algorithm) and predict the function of their proteins using BLAST and HMMER. ---- **About this Galaxy wrapper** *Installation* #. `Docker `_ should first be installed and working on the server where this Galaxy instance is setup. The **galaxy** user should be part of the **docker** group. #. Download or clone the VirAnnot_ Github repository (as a submodule) in to the ``tools`` directory. #. Update ``config/tool_conf.xml`` like this::
#. Update ``config/tool_data_table_conf.xml`` to add location of loc files:: value, dbkey, name, path
value, dbkey, name, path
value, dbkey, name, path
#. Copy ``.loc`` files from ``virannot/tool-data`` to ``galaxy/tool-data`` and update the database paths within those files. #. Restart Galaxy. ---- **Output files** VirAnnot creates the following output files: * tbl - Table file with all protein information. * gbk - GenBank format file with annotations. * fasta - FASTA format file for GenBank submission * csv - Table file for GenBank submission. * gff - GFF3 format file (if option is selected) ---- **License and citation** VirAnnot_ and this Galaxy wrapper - `GPLv3 `_. "Galaxy: a comprehensive approach for supporting accessible, reproducible, and transparent computational research in the life sciences."
